definition: Hungary/Hungarian/abbr. for 匈牙利[Xiong1 ya2 li4]
old variant of 胸[xiong1]
archaic variant of 包[bao1]
vicious/fierce/ominous/inauspicious/famine/variant of 兇|凶[xiong1]
Hungary
Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
Hungarian language
Hungarian language
Austro-Hungarian Empire 1867-1918

sentences.english: Hungarian V43 EL was standing-by at the border of Austria and Hungary.
sentences.chinese: 奧匈邊境等待上陣的匈牙利V43型電力機車。

sentences.english: Following the breakup of Austria-Hungary, a Slovak Soviet Republic was created for a very short time.
sentences.chinese: 奧匈帝國解體後，很快建立了一個斯洛伐克共和國。

sentences.english: The time from earlier Qin to Qin and Han dynasty, was the important period for the formation ofthe Han and Hun.
sentences.chinese: 先秦至秦漢時期，是漢匈民族形成的重要時期。

sentences.english: Premier Wen's historic visit to Hungary is highly meaningful.
sentences.chinese: 溫家寶總理對匈的歷史性訪問意義重大。

sentences.english: 1918 - World War I: Austria-Hungary surrenders to Italy.
sentences.chinese: 1918年的今天，一戰中奧匈帝國向意大利投降。

sentences.english: Italy wanted to liberate territory from the Austro-Hungarians.
sentences.chinese: 意大利想要解放奧匈帝國。

sentences.english: Vienna is the capital of breast kingdom in the past, the one in the past is remained luxuriously and magnificently.
sentences.chinese: 維也納是往日奧匈帝國的首都，昔日的豪華氣派尚存。

definition: Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
variant of 羌[qiang1]
ancient people of central Asia during the Han dynasty

man

Wusun kingdom of central Asia (c. 300 BC-300 AD)

Outer Mongolia (lit. north of the Gobi Desert)

ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
